customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Dainsleif</color>
At one time, he was Master's rival. At another, they were best friends, apparently... I had hoped he might give me some more information about Master, but the moment he recognized my style of bladework, he got very agitated and demanded to know Master's whereabouts. I don't want to deal with him. Hopefully I don't run into him again any time soon.
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Dainsleif</color>
That man, Dainsleif, was the "Twilight Sword," one of the royal guards of the final dynasty of Khaenri'ah. 500 years ago, he failed to prevent the destruction of Khaenri'ah.
A curse of immortality was laid upon him, to forever wander the wilderness... while he watched the people he was supposed to protect turn into the monsters of the Abyss.

customize.name: Halfdan
customize.desc: An elite in the Royal Guard of Khaenri'ah under the Twilight Sword's command.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Khaenri'ah</color>
<color=#37ffff>Halfdan</color> : Apologies, Captain Dainsleif, Twilight Sword. Back then... I failed you, and failed to protect our people
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : No, for five hundred years, you have faithfully done your duty
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : To this day, I am proud of you all
<color=#37ffff>Halfdan</color> : Khaenri'ah... didn't fall, did it? Since you're still here...
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : Correct
<color=#37ffff>Dainsleif</color> : So... no need to revive the homeland

Paimon's Paintings include a collection of chibi emojis of various Genshin Impact characters. We hope you like them! Paimon will continue to paint more cute emojis for everyone~
The Cataclysm

Over five hundred years ago, the "Twilight Sword" Dainsleif was the captain of the royal guard of Khaenri'ah, an unprecedented, flourishing, and powerful nation built entirely by humans. When his older brother, Vedrfolnir, was blinded in both eyes and imprisoned for giving an oracle, Dainsleif gathered the brilliant young ones of the age, "The Wise" Hroptatyr, "The Visionary" Vedrfolnir, "Gold" Rhinedottir, "The Foul" Surtalogi, and "Rächer of Solnari" Rerir, to save him. They were once people of great esteem in Khaenri'ah, those who carried the hopes of the nation. According to the plan, the six of them were supposed to prevent a catastrophe and stop the Vinster King from continuing to rock the foundation of the world. But deep down, five of them wanted more and could not resist the call of the Abyss, so they divided the power capable of destroying the entire world among themselves. Vedrfolnir, Rhinedottir, Hroptatyr, Rerir, and Surtalogi became the Sinners — transcendent beings, each in possession of world-shattering power. And when disaster struck, only Dainsleif stood up to protect his people. When King Irmin and the sages tore the veil of sin, and monsters from the Abyss created by Rhinedottir filled Teyvat, the Heavenly Principles sent the Archons of the seven kingdoms to Khaenri'ah, and the nation without gods itself was destroyed.
<color=#ffffffd9>"The 'pride of humankind' was uprooted and crushed, like a weed removed from the garden of the gods…"</color>

Along with the guards, the Twilight Sword defended his country, but was unable to save it. His last order on the day of the cataclysm was to protect the people of Khaenri'ah at all costs. During the disaster, all pure-blooded Khaenri'ahns, including Dainsleif, were cursed with immortality, while the rest were transformed into monsters, the Hilichurls. Under the curse of immortality, the Black Serpent Knights under the Twilight Sword's command lost their minds and memories, turning into empty husks that only had the will to destroy the enemy and defend. Unlike his comrades, Dainsleif was able to retain his mind using the ring left by his brother, although his body is gradually eroded, his memories fade, and he is forced to watch as the people he was supposed to protect are transformed into monsters of the Abyss. Due to the process of erosion, the Twilight Sword is forced to wear a mask, and part of his body is covered in traces of the curse. He swore vengeance on the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, even if all memories were erased from his mind.

With Khaenri'ah destroyed, Dainsleif, along with the
of the kingdom and the other surviving knights, traveled to Sumeru, which was located above their underground kingdom. While the Schwanenritter in the giant Ruin Golems destroyed the monsters in the desert and forest, Dainsleif, together with the one-armed sage, Nagarjuna, and the first Pari, withstood the onslaught of monsters that rushed towards them like a tide. He also fought in a battle near Tunigi Hollow in the northernmost part of the desert, where the monsters emerged to the surface. Many knights of Khaenri'ah, people of Sumeru, and Pari gave their lives, and when the battle was over, the first Pari, Zurvan, found Dainsleif clutching a ring tightly in his hand. She returned with him to the Vourukasha Oasis, the homeland of the Pari, and after he awoke, they traveled together for some time, fighting the monsters that had invaded the oasis. As the monsters gradually disappeared from the face of the earth, Dainsleif and the Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah set out on a journey to confront fate. Dainsleif first saw the Princess/Prince when he was still a young knight, and King Irmin announced a new heir. Gradually, the Princess/Prince was used as a vessel by which unlimited Abyssal power could be absorbed and became the key to the world's near-annihilation.

During their journey together, Dainsleif and the Princess/Prince went to Avidya Forest. When Dainsleif went to explore the forest, his companion met Chlothar Alberich, one of the cursed Khaenri'ahns. He immediately recognized the Princess/Prince, but did not want to reveal his true identity, so he introduced himself under a false name. In an attempt to cure their illegitimate son, Caribert, who had turned into a hilichurl, Chlothar and the Princess/Prince turned to the
who was able to temporarily restore Caribert's sanity. Alberich hoped that with the
Caribert could become the "Loom of Fate" and weave his fate anew. Although the boy was not destined to survive, the idea of ​​the "Loom of Fate" was born in the thoughts of Chlothar and the Princess/Prince, so she/he didn't tell Dainsleif about the meeting with Alberich. Alberich later became the founder of the Abyss Order, which was joined by former Khaenri'ahns who became monsters of the Abyss. The monsters that serve the Abyss are the fangs and claws with which the Order sows chaos on this land. The Abyss is destruction and a morass of inconceivable madness that encroaches upon this world's very foundations. The goal of the Order was the overthrow of a world ruled by the Archons. Over time, Dainsleif's companion joined the Order, considering Dainsleif her/his enemy. In succession, she/he became known as the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order. In turn, the Twilight Sword began to fight against the Abyss Order and the power they used to prevent them from betraying the entire world.

<color=#ffffffd9>"And that which came thereafter, where the two spirits bound by common agony would journey together, would also seem but a single point of intersection in their all-too-long, gradually diverging lives."</color>
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: Search of the Abyss Herald

Five hundred years of wandering and fighting against the Abyss Order led Dainsleif to Mondstadt, where, according to his information, traces of an Abyss Herald, an uglier spawn of the Abyss to whom its mages obey, were found. When the Twilight Sword appeared in Mondstadt, one of the Knights of Favonius began to follow him, but Dainsleif easily got rid of the surveillance. After that, he inquired about special forging materials from the blacksmith, Wagner, but the latter had not even heard of such materials. A suspicious man with blonde hair and a blindfold was seen in the Angel's Share tavern, where the Traveler went to find out about the stranger. When they met, Dainsleif asked for five hundred Mora and answers to three questions. First, he asked who played a key role in the victory together with the Anemo Archon over the Stormterror. The second question was, <color=#ffffffd9>"Rex Lapis, who has defended Liyue Harbor for millennia on end, used his Gnosis to lay down a Contract to End All Contracts, of which the stipulations are still unknown. Who will defend Liyue Harbor in the future, now that they've lost their deity?"</color> He asked lastly who is more important to the gods: those who have the Vision, or those who have not received it. After three answers and five hundred Mora, Dainsleif explained his goals in Mondstadt and suggested meeting at the Temple of the Falcon, which was overrun by the Abyss Order.

Although the Traveler had already encountered the Abyss Order when rescuing
it had orders to avoid the Traveler. Inside the temple, they encountered several Abyss Mages, but the Abyss Herald had already left, and they went to see the King of the North Winds, Andrius. Dainsleif knew that his
was interested in the wolf's history, so he wanted to check the place out. There had been Abyss Order activity in Wolvendom, and there were Abyss spells near Andrius's lair, but there were no signs of the Abyss Herald either. Dainsleif's last stop was Stormterror's Lair. He had been there before with the Traveler's sibling, before Dvalin had fallen and taken up residence in the ruins of Old Mondstadt. When he and the Traveler were examining the Light Actuators that once sealed this ruin, the Traveler had a "familiar feeling" that someone was watching them from the cliff. When they got there, there was no one on the cliff except for the tracks of the Ruin Guards, the machines created in Khaenri'ah. Touching a dandelion near the tracks, the Traveler suddenly remembered their sibling and the hope of returning home.

<color=#ffffffd9>"At least you now know that she/he is still on this world.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>At this time, the most important thing is the journey to find her/him itself.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And this is something you must keep in mind as the meaning behind your journey."</color>

Finding no trace of the Abyss Herald, Dainsleif bid farewell to the Traveler and promised to meet again soon. After some time, Dainsleif's search for the Abyss Herald led him to some ruins in Liyue, where the Traveler and Paimon went after the Treasure Hoarder "Master Thief." In these ruins, the Abyss Order hid the stolen Statue of The Seven, which was not only upside down, but instead of the usual sphere, it held the energy of the Abyss in its hands. When the Traveler and Paimon found Master Thief, he was dead and sitting in front of the inverted statue, as if praying to someone. As they were leaving the ruins, the Abyss Herald appeared before them, sensing the power of the
of the Abyss Order in the Traveler. Although the Abyss Herald managed to escape, Dainsleif, upon hearing of what had happened, offered to chase him down. During the chase, they encountered Abyss Mages who were trying to find something among the energy-deprived
After the destruction of Khaenri'ah, the Field Tillers lost their masters and went completely out of control. For five centuries, they wandered aimlessly across the lands and scattered throughout Teyvat. On one of the defeated Abyss Mages, the Traveler, Paimon, and Dainsleif found a talisman that read, <color=#ffffffd9>"...Engulf the faith of the enemy in flame, and bring glory to Her Highness, the Princess/His Highness, the Prince. ...'Loom of Fate,' initial operation."</color> <color=#ffffff73>The first phase of the plan was related to Osial, Overlord of the Vortex. During the Archon War, Rex Lapis defeated him and buried him under huge stone spears, but several thousand years later, Osial was reawakened and attacked Liyue. The Abyss Order wanted to use "the Defiled Statue" as a base, attaching Osial's limbs to construct a mechanized god, and the new core that shall replace the orb usually held by the Statue of The Seven would be the eye of the very first Field Tiller. Thereby imbuing the newly born god with the power to "topple the divine thrones of Celestia."</color>
Realizing that the Abyss Order was conducting preliminary tests for a large-scale operation, Dainsleif and the Traveler set out to learn more about the inverted statue and the eye of the first Field Tiller. Since the statue resembled one of the Anemo Archon Barbatos's statues, they set out for Mondstadt, but Dainsleif refused to enter the Church of Favonius.

<color=#ffffffd9>"I have no problem interacting with people. But interacting with gods... that's a different story.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>It's just my opinion, but a word of advice: Always be on your guard when around gods.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>You shouldn't place too much trust in them. But at the same time, don't go too far in the opposite direction... Don't go trying to overthrow them, or hunt them down."</color>

Long ago, the Statue of The Seven disappeared from its place without a trace, but the ministers of the church were never able to find it. In addition, there was an old story about "The Tyrant's Final Fury" — a danger that lived in the ruins of ancient Mondstadt, now known as the Stormterror's Lair. Many years ago, balls of fire would rain from the sky whenever anyone approached Old Mondstadt. People at that time believed that it was a curse laid down by the God of Storms, Decarabian, so they referred to it as "The Tyrant's Final Fury." This strange phenomenon continued for about a year. No one was ever able to solve it, and it just gradually ceased on its own. As the Traveler and Paimon were leaving the church, they heard about the attack of the Abyss Order in the vicinity of Wolvendom, so they hurried to Andrius together with Dainsleif, but the latter refused to go to the King of the North Winds again.

<color=#ffffffd9>"It's because Boreas was an ancient god, yet he willingly became a servant of The Seven.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I cannot possibly agree with his actions. I don't desire any interaction with him."</color>

Lupus Boreas's spirit was captured by the Abyss Herald, who promised to restore his divine powers if he swore allegiance to the Abyss Order. Thanks to the intervention of the Traveler, the Order's ceremony was interrupted, and the Abyss Herald escaped again. They learned from Andrius that "The Tyrant's Final Fury" was actually a Field Tiller. He had once appeared in the arena of the King of the North Winds, who mistook the mechanism for a brave man who had challenged him. The machine could not think, but all its parts were made for killing and fighting: it could spin, fly high into the air, and shoot fireballs. Andrius was eventually able to defeat the machine, but it managed to leave the arena before it fell, heading for Old Mondstadt.

In Stormterror's Lair, Dainsleif and the Traveler discovered the first Field Tiller, and the Twilight Sword used special powers to extract the eye that the Abyss Order was hunting for and hid the eye in his body to prevent it from falling into their hands. In order to thwart the plans of the Order, Dainsleif and the Traveler went to the ruins of Liyue to destroy the inverted statue and defeat the Abyss Herald. When the Herald was about to be defeated, Dainsleif's power was blocked by the suddenly appeared Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order. They called Dainsleif an enemy and promised the Traveler to meet again when they finished their journey. When the Princess/Prince and the Abyss Herald opened a portal to disappear, Dainsleif rushed after them and teleported.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: Requiem of the Echoing Depths

When Dainsleif rushed into the portal after the Abyss Herald, they appeared in different places, as the Abyss Order's portals did not connect two points, but formed a large network. When the Twilight Sword was later chasing another Abyss Herald, he traveled through this network and ended up in the depths of the Chasm. Realizing that the Abyss Order needed a teleportation node in this place for some reason, he decided to explore the place and met the Traveler and Paimon, who were investigating the strange behavior of the Hilichurls. The Chasm miners noticed that they were going deep into the mines as if in a trance and never returned. The investigation led the Traveler and Paimon to an upside-down city of an ancient civilization, similar in architecture to Khaenri'ah, but much older. Near the upside-down city, Dainsleif felt that the surrounding environment was weakening the curse placed on him and the Hilichurls. For centuries, he had suffered daily from the curse, but there he suddenly felt a small amount of relief from this suffering. The curse of immortality denied death to those afflicted with it, but the body and soul would continue to be eroded until they were virtually nonexistent, even if "death" is not the form that this erosion took. When the hilichurls realized that the end was nigh for them, they instinctively sought a calm and dark place to say goodbye to centuries of suffering, and a place where the power of the curse weakened was best suited for this.

While going to the upside-down city, Dainsleif, the Traveler, and Paimon were attacked by a group of the Black Serpent Knights who, under the influence of the curse and the Abyss, lost their minds and turned into empty husks. One of the knights standing in the distance seemed familiar to Dainsleif and seemed to want to say something, but he soon disappeared. Inside the upside-down city, they encountered other Black Serpent Knights, who were protecting the hilichurls, whose end was near. The familiar knight appeared again and ordered the others to retreat, and Dainsleif recognized him as Halfdan, once a young warrior of the royal guard. On the day of Khaenri'ah's fall, the Twilight Sword had ordered Halfdan to protect the people of Khaenri'ah at all costs, and even after the Cataclysm and the corruption of the curse, the guards continued to carry out this order. In the upper levels of the city, Dainsleif and the Traveler discovered an upside-down fountain, the water of which had a "cleansing" effect and weakened the curse. But even the fountain could not completely remove the curse: it was woven into the fate of the world itself, and existed on a higher level of reality than the person themselves.

Halfdan appeared again, motioned for Dainsleif and the Traveler to follow him, and went to the hilichurls, who had almost merged with the darkness. Near one of the hilichurls, the Traveler found an Inteyvat flower, the Khaenri'ah national flower, which once bloomed in all corners of the nation. Its bloom lasted only two weeks, and if the flower was picked and taken away from Khaenri'ah, the petals stopped growing and hardened. Only after the flower returned to its native soil did the petals become soft again and eventually turn to dust. To the people of Khaenri'ah, the Inteyvat was a symbol for a wanderer far from home, signifying the tenderness of the homeland. In addition, this flower was worn in Lumine's hair. Upon touching the flower, the Traveler saw their twin discussing the ritual to revive Khaenri'ah with the Abyss Herald using the device underneath the fountain. Dainsleif was certain that the revival of his homeland and the lifting of the curse were impossible, and attempting to forcibly dispel it would only lead to more suffering. The Traveler agreed, so they hurried to stop the Abyss Order from trampling the will of Halfdan and the other Black Serpent Knights.

As Dainsleif, the Traveler, and Paimon were returning to the fountain, a bright flash of light suddenly appeared from that room, and their path was blocked by the Abyss Herald. After destroying it, they hurried into the room, but the Abyss Order had already used the amplifying device to increase the cleansing effect of the fountain's water hundreds of times. Although they expected the process to free them from the curse, the hilichurls, Black Serpent Knights, and Dainsleif himself experienced only extreme pain. Despite the immense suffering, Halfdan rushed to the device and stopped the process by sacrificing himself. But even after Halfdan's sacrifice, the device remained activated. After all the power supply mechanisms were destroyed, the device was finally turned off, but Halfdan no longer had any life left. As Dainsleif was about to leave, Halfdan's spirit regained its senses for a moment and was able to bid farewell to the Twilight Sword, dissolving without a trace.
The ritual performed by the Abyss Order had greatly weakened Dainsleif, so it took him time to recover. But even despite the suffering, he could not rest, as the Loom of Fate project was still active, and the amplifying devices in the Chasm could be connected to it.

Although legends remain mere legends, one should always expect the unexpected when exploring this labyrinthine underground mineshaft.

customize.text: Loom of Fate

While Dainsleif was recovering from the Abyss Order ritual in the Chasm, he suddenly remembered that he had heard of the "Loom of Fate" during his travels with the Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah. His memories, which were crumbling under the effects of erosion, came together, and he remembered that they were traveling through Sumeru when the topic came up, so he decided to go to Avidya Forest to look for clues. Calling the Traveler and Paimon to join him, the Twilight Sword found an abandoned field and a house in the forest that seemed familiar. The house belonged to Chlothar Alberich, who was trying to heal his son, Caribert. When Dainsleif went to check the Ley Lines, the Traveler felt the memories of their twin as if they had lived them themselves. He saw Alberich, Caribert, and the Sinner. After founding the Abyss Order, Chlothar's faith in it drove him to do many things, but the curse of immortality endlessly tormented his body and spirit, and the Abyss he believed in ultimately failed to save him. A hundred years later, he finally lost his mind and disappeared, but his dark legacy lived on, and the inverted statue that Dainsleif and the Traveler saw in Liyue was just one of the mysterious creations of his Abyss power. After seeing it, the Traveler decided to dig up the field near the house, where they found the remains of Caribert's mother and Chlothar himself, who had somehow managed to lift the curse.

Since Dainsleif needed time to fish out the missing memories from his memory and confirm the identity of the Sinner, he bid farewell to the Traveler and Paimon. Their next encounter occurred when the Twilight Sword was investigating the strange monster activity near Vimara Village, where the Traveler and Paimon had gone on a commission to find a missing person. Dainsleif believed that the change in the Ley Lines and the monster activity might be related to the Abyss Order's plan, so he set out to investigate the "Loom of Fate" to understand the true purpose of the Abyss Order. According to the information he received, the plan was somehow related to the Ley Lines, the disturbance of which was always accompanied by the activity of Abyssal monsters. When the Traveler and Paimon found out while searching for the missing boy that he only existed in the people's memories flowing through the Ley Lines, they decided to team up with Dainsleif. The next morning, the Twilight Sword suddenly had memories of the missing boy that he had never had before. In these memories, he gave the boy the eye of the first Field Tiller, which he had hidden from the Abyss Order for a long time. In order to check if the Field Tiller's eye was still there, they went to the ruins of an ancient civilization near the village. Deep in the ruins, they were attacked by the Abyss Herald, and Dainsleif, sensing a change in the Ley Lines, sent the Traveler and Paimon back to find the missing person. After they escaped, the Twilight Sword met with the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order. He knew that he could only meet them in person if he fell into the trap of the Abyss Order. Even after the Princess/Prince's betrayal, Dainsleif was unable to immediately raise his sword against them, so they were able to defeat him.

When the Traveler found the missing person, it was Chlothar Alberich's son, Caribert. Although he died in childhood, he was used to create the "Loom of Fate." His consciousness lingered in the mechanism, and he gained the ability to control the device until it was completed. Caribert was able to figure out Dainsleif's plan: he knew that the Order was after the Field Tiller's eye, so he was going to give it to the Traveler so that they could take it from its hiding place. But this plan was disrupted when Caribert created memories that Dainsleif had already given the Field Tiller's eye. Thus, the Abyss Order was able to obtain the eye and complete the creation of the Loom of Fate.

customize.name: Abyss Order
customize.desc: An organization comprised of the cursed Khaenri'ahns and non-human monsters. They are the enemies of surface civilization and thrive in many corners of the world. Their main goal is to destroy the world under the rule of The Seven.

customize.name: Loom of Fate
customize.desc: A device created by the Abyss Order that is capable of weaving Ley Lines. Using the Loom of Fate, the Atlas of the New World was created — reconstructed Ley Lines of New Khaenri'ah based on the memories of 500 years ago.

customize.name: Twin
customize.desc: The Traveler's twin, Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah, Savior, and the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order.

customize.name: Chlothar
customize.desc: A pure-blood Khaenri'ahn who was cursed with immortality by Celestia. He is a member of the Alberich Clan and the founder of the Abyss Order.

customize.name: Caribert
customize.desc: Chlothar Alberich's illegitimate son who became a hilichurl due to the Heavenly Principles' curse. He was used to create the Loom of Fate.

customize.text: Atlas of the New World

When the Loom of Fate was complete, the Abyss Order attacked Natlan. The Order had never launched such a large-scale attack before, and they knew that in a war with the Natlanese, the odds were stacked firmly against them, but their true goal was a deeper one. Tribal watchers noticed that many of the Order didn't attack, but were wandering around the area, as if in meditation and prayer. The watchers contacted the shamans, but they could not find out the reason, and the Natlanese decided to ignore it. The great Shaman of the Masters of the Night-Wind had a dream that some "noise" had found its way into Natlan's Ley Lines, but this noise had no real effect on the Night Kingdom or the Ley Lines, as if they existed in parallel, independently of each other, like a signal that exists in a different dimension of reality. The Shaman did not detect a risk, but she knew for sure that the Abyss Order was planning something.

While the Natlanese were preparing their forces to launch a counterattack, Dainsleif suddenly appeared on the front lines of the Abyss Order, stormed the enemy lines, and attacked with vengeance, cutting them down like paper dolls. By the time the guards reacted, the front line was destroyed, and the monsters retreated in the direction of the Cinder City, where their main headquarters would be located. Since the Twilight Sword could not wait for reinforcements from the Natlanese, he, along with the Traveler, went to Ochkanatlan to find out the true motive of the Order. During his hunt for the Abyss Order in Natlan, Dainsleif interrogated several of the Order's captured monsters, but he was unable to find out anything, so he decided to focus on military action. If the Order was willing to sacrifice all of its strength to carry out a secret plan, the Twilight Sword wanted to make their sacrifice as tangible as possible.

In Ochkanatlan, Dainsleif and the Traveler encountered an Iniquitous Baptist, who was the commander of the Abyss Order's headquarters. After his defeat, the Baptist revealed that the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order had already achieved victory, and the rest of the Order's task was to attract attention to themselves. The Princess/Prince had quietly infiltrated the Night Kingdom and used Natlan's experience of restoring the Ley Lines to create the Atlas of the New World — a recreation of the Khaenri'ah Ley Lines from five hundred years ago using the Loom of Fate.

Dainsleif did not believe the words of the Iniquitous Baptist, and when the Traveler and Paimon left to find out about the revived Khaenri'ah, the Twilight Sword recognized the monster as his former mentor from the Knights Academy, Haden. Although they were unable to kill each other due to the curse of immortality, Dainsleif still longed to kill him a hundred times over. During his time as a teacher at the Academy, Haden brutally suppressed the next generation of knights to maintain his reputation, and even Dainsleif's fellow student, Surtalogi, was maimed because of him. But five hundred years later, due to erosion and the power of the Abyss, Haden's memories, personality, soul, and feelings had long been erased, and he could not remember anything. He asked his former student to share the memories of their home, as the Twilight Sword was the only one able to retain memories through the ring. And although Dainsleif would not share the stories of Khaenri'ah, he opened his memories to the Loom of Fate, which is what the Abyss Order wanted. With the memories of almost the entire Order having faded by the erosion, they needed Dainsleif's memories to create a new Khaenri'ah from. When the Twilight Sword realized that Haden lied that the Loom of Fate was completed and that his own memories became the key element of the mechanism, he promised Haden a hundred more deaths for his deception.
